stories.text:
Please state the location and include REMOTE, INTERNS and/or VISA when that sort of candidate is welcome. When remote work is not an option, include ONSITE.

Please only post if you personally are part of the hiring company—no recruiting firms or job boards. Only one post per company. If it isn't a household name, please explain what your company does.

Commenters: please don't reply to job posts to complain about something. It's off topic here.

Readers: please only email if you are personally interested in the job.

Searchers: try https://kennytilton.github.io/whoishiring/, https://hnhired.com/, https://hnjobs.emilburzo.com, https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=10313519.

Don't miss these other fine threads:

Who wants to be hired? https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30164269

Freelancer? Seeking freelancer? https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30164270
stories.title: Ask HN: Who is hiring? (February 2022)

stories.text:
Please lead with either SEEKING WORK or SEEKING FREELANCER, your location, and whether remote work is a possibility.

Bonsai (YC W16) (https://www.hellobonsai.com) offers freelance contracts, proposals, invoices, etc.
stories.title: Ask HN: Freelancer? Seeking freelancer? (February 2022)

stories.text:
Share your information if you are looking for work. Please use this format:

  Location:
  Remote:
  Willing to relocate:
  Technologies:
  Résumé/CV:
  Email:
Readers: please only email these addresses to discuss work opportunities.

Searchers: try https://seisvelas.github.io/hn-candidates-search/ or https://hirehackernews.com/.
stories.title: Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (February 2022)

stories.text:
Today, a friend asked me how to transfer about 60 GB of images from her iPhone to her Windows computer, because the phone is so full that it's not working properly.

The obvious answer is use a cable, but here cable seems to have a loose connection so it cuts out mid transfer. iTunes wants to make a backup which you can't cancel and then the computer stops working.

My first thought was create a torrent file, send it to Windows via any chat app or mail and open it on the PC.

Now before giving her instructions I wanted to try the solution, although I do use an Android, but generally apps are more or less the same on Android and on iOS.

Following my common sense I downloaded the most downloaded torrent manager and then spent a few minutes searching for an option to create a torrent file. Being unable to find the solution, I went on Google...

'How to create a torrent file on iPhone'

Googles gave me only how to download torrents results. But I didn't give up, I'm good with computer stuff!

'How to "create" a torrent file on iPhone'

More or less same results... Welp, let's try Bing don't laugh... No solution.

After about 5 hours of trying, she decided to go for a run and have a dinner.

Oh and she's going to ask a friend to borrow her a cable and an iMac just to be sure.

I also wanted to try to SSH into the iPhone but you need to jailbreak it.

Google Photos has a limit of 15 GB. iCloud has 5 GB. Mega.nz has a limit of 50 GB.

Using a torrent would work, but if you can't create a torrent file, then you can't use the torrents.

Why is it so hard to transfer a lot of files from a phone to the PC without using the cable? Did I miss something extremely obvious?
stories.title: Tell HN: Want to see Google fail? Try to find how to create a torrent on iPhone
Rare kinds of coffee, wine, and other foods could go extinct
